Q_and_not_P.title: Will the Trump family endorse a non-family candidate for the 2024 election and have no member as the Republican nominee?
Q_and_not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By December 31, 2024, any member of the Trump family officially endorses a candidate for the 2024 election who is not a family member. The endorsement must be publicly announced through a credible medium such as a press release, a public event, or a verified social media account, and must be clear and unambiguous, indicating support for the non-family candidate in the context of the 2024 presidential election. Any informal statements or suggestions will not count towards this resolution. In case of conflicting endorsements, the first official endorsement will be considered. (2) None of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, any member of the Trump family officially endorses a candidate for the 2024 election who is not a family member (i.e., not Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, or Donald Trump himself). The endorsement must be publicly announced through a credible medium such as a press release, a public event, or a verified social media account. The endorsement must be clear and unambiguous, indicating support for the non-family candidate in the context of the 2024 presidential election. Any informal statements or suggestions will not count towards this resolution. In case of conflicting endorsements, the first official endorsement will be considered.

P.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 1, 2024, Donald Trump is officially declared the Republican nominee for the 2024 United States Presidential Election by the Republican National Committee (RNC). The determination of the nominee will be based on the outcome of the Republican primaries and caucuses, culminating in the Republican National Convention. If Donald Trump secures the majority of delegates needed to win the nomination or is confirmed as the nominee by the RNC through a formal announcement, the question will resolve as Yes. Any credible reports from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming this outcome will also suffice as evidence.

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Q_and_not_P.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee?
Q_and_not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who is the nominee on the day of the election.

2. By July 1, 2024, Donald Trump is not officially declared the Republican nominee for the 2024 United States Presidential Election by the Republican National Committee (RNC). This is based on the outcome of the Republican primaries and caucuses, and a formal announcement by the RNC. Credible reports from major news organizations confirming this outcome will also suffice as evidence.

The question resolves as **No** if either Tucker Carlson is not the nominee or Donald Trump is the nominee, or both.

P_or_Q.title: Will either Donald Trump or Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
P_or_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) By July 1, 2024, Donald Trump is officially declared the Republican nominee for the 2024 United States Presidential Election by the Republican National Committee (RNC). This includes securing the majority of delegates needed to win the nomination or being confirmed as the nominee by the RNC through a formal announcement. Credible reports from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming this outcome will suffice as evidence. (b) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

P.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by July 1, 2024, Donald Trump is officially declared the Republican nominee for the 2024 United States Presidential Election by the Republican National Committee (RNC). The determination of the nominee will be based on the outcome of the Republican primaries and caucuses, culminating in the Republican National Convention. If Donald Trump secures the majority of delegates needed to win the nomination or is confirmed as the nominee by the RNC through a formal announcement, the question will resolve as Yes. Any credible reports from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming this outcome will also suffice as evidence.

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Q.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
Q.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A third-party candidate emerges to challenge the Republican nominee in the 2024 election (2) Tucker Carlson is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
Q_and_not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: 

1. A third-party candidate has officially declared their candidacy for the presidency of the United States and is actively campaigning against the Republican nominee for the 2024 election by December 31, 2024. The candidate must be recognized as a legitimate third-party candidate, meaning they are not affiliated with the Republican Party and are running under a different party banner or as an independent. The candidate must also appear on the ballot in at least 5 states and have received at least 5% of the popular vote in any major poll conducted after the official nomination of the Republican candidate. The declaration of candidacy must be reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) to be considered valid.

2. Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Tucker Carlson is selected, it will resolve as No. This condition is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. The resolution is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

P_or_Q.title: Will either Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or a third-party candidate emerge to challenge the Republican nominee?
P_or_Q.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (b) By December 31, 2024, a third-party candidate has officially declared their candidacy for the presidency of the United States and is actively campaigning against the Republican nominee for the 2024 election. The candidate must be recognized as a legitimate third-party candidate, not affiliated with the Republican Party, and running under a different party banner or as an independent. They must appear on the ballot in at least 5 states and have received at least 5% of the popular vote in any major poll conducted after the official nomination of the Republican candidate. The declaration must be reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

P.title: Will Ivanka Trump seek a political office by 2024?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Ivanka Trump has officially announced her candidacy for any political office in the United States, which includes but is not limited to local, state, or federal positions. The announcement must be made through a reputable source such as a press release, social media statement from her official accounts, or coverage from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Any exploratory committees or informal statements will not count as a declaration of intent to seek office. The resolution will also consider any confirmed candidacy for the 2024 election cycle, regardless of the office level.

(b) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

P.title: Will Donald Trump lead in national polls against potential Democratic candidates in 2024?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, at any point during the calendar year 2024, Donald Trump is leading in national polling averages against any potential Democratic candidate for the 2024 presidential election. The polling data must be sourced from at least three reputable polling organizations (such as Gallup, Quinnipiac, Ipsos, or FiveThirtyEight) and must be publicly available. The average must show Trump with a higher percentage of support than the Democratic candidate in question, based on a minimum of three polls conducted during the year. The question resolves as No if Trump does not lead in any national poll against any Democratic candidate at any point in 2024.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and never lead in national polls against any potential Democratic candidate in 2024?
Q_and_not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) At no point during the calendar year 2024 does Donald Trump lead in national polling averages against any potential Democratic candidate for the 2024 presidential election. The polling data must be sourced from at least three reputable polling organizations (such as Gallup, Quinnipiac, Ipsos, or FiveThirtyEight) and must be publicly available. The average must not show Trump with a higher percentage of support than the Democratic candidate in question, based on a minimum of three polls conducted during the year. The question resolves as **No** if either Trump is not the Republican nominee or he leads in any national poll against any Democratic candidate at any point in 2024.

The average must show Trump with a higher percentage of support than the Democratic candidate in question, based on a minimum of three polls conducted during the year. (b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. The question resolves as No if neither of these conditions is met.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will Donald Trump run for President again in 2024 and will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
Q_and_not_P.body: This question resolves as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By December 31, 2024, Donald Trump has officially declared his candidacy for the 2024 Presidential election. An official declaration must be made through a public statement or announcement, and it must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If Trump is listed as a candidate on the ballot for the 2024 Presidential election, this will also count as a Yes, regardless of his prior announcements. Any informal statements or speculation about running do not count towards this resolution. (2) None of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump. Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as Yes.

An official declaration must be made through a public statement or announcement and reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post), or if Trump is listed as a candidate on the ballot for the 2024 Presidential election. Informal statements or speculation do not count towards this resolution.

P.title: Will Ron DeSantis gain more support than Tucker Carlson among Republican voters by 2024?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Ron DeSantis has a higher percentage of support among Republican voters than Tucker Carlson in a reputable national poll conducted by a recognized polling organization (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research, Ipsos, YouGov). The poll must include at least 1,000 respondents and be conducted within the last month of 2024. If multiple polls are conducted, the most recent poll before the resolution date will be used. Support is defined as the percentage of respondents who indicate a preference for DeSantis over Carlson when asked about their preferred candidate for the Republican nomination for President. Polls that do not specifically ask about DeSantis and Carlson will not count. In the event of a tie, the question will resolve as No.

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Q_and_not_P.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and have more support than Ron DeSantis among Republican voters by the end of 2024?
Q_and_not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) by December 31, 2024, Tucker Carlson has a higher percentage of support than Ron DeSantis among Republican voters in a reputable national poll conducted by a recognized polling organization (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research, Ipsos, YouGov). The poll must include at least 1,000 respondents and be conducted within the last month of 2024. Support is defined as the percentage of respondents who indicate a preference for Carlson over DeSantis when asked about their preferred candidate for the Republican nomination for President. Polls that do not specifically ask about DeSantis and Carlson will not count. Any other outcome will result in a No resolution.

P_or_Q.body:
(a) Ron DeSantis gains more support than Tucker Carlson among Republican voters: This will be resolved as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Ron DeSantis has a higher percentage of support among Republican voters than Tucker Carlson in a reputable national poll conducted by a recognized polling organization (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research, Ipsos, YouGov). The poll must include at least 1,000 respondents and be conducted within the last month of 2024. If multiple polls are conducted, the most recent poll before the resolution date will be used. Support is defined as the percentage of respondents who indicate a preference for DeSantis over Carlson when asked about their preferred candidate for the Republican nomination for President. Polls that do not specifically ask about DeSantis and Carlson will not count. In the event of a tie, the question will resolve as No.

(b) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This will resolve as Yes if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as No. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

P.title: Will Ron DeSantis gain more support than Tucker Carlson among Republican voters by 2024?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Ron DeSantis has a higher percentage of support among Republican voters than Tucker Carlson in a reputable national poll conducted by a recognized polling organization (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research, Ipsos, YouGov). The poll must include at least 1,000 respondents and be conducted within the last month of 2024. If multiple polls are conducted, the most recent poll before the resolution date will be used. Support is defined as the percentage of respondents who indicate a preference for DeSantis over Carlson when asked about their preferred candidate for the Republican nomination for President. Polls that do not specifically ask about DeSantis and Carlson will not count. In the event of a tie, the question will resolve as No.

Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump leads in national polls against any potential Democratic candidates in 2024 and (b) Donald Trump is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
Q_and_not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) At any point during the calendar year 2024, Donald Trump is leading in national polling averages against any potential Democratic candidate for the 2024 presidential election. The polling data must be sourced from at least three reputable polling organizations (such as Gallup, Quinnipiac, Ipsos, or FiveThirtyEight) and must be publicly available. The average must show Trump with a higher percentage of support than the Democratic candidate in question, based on a minimum of three polls conducted during the year. (b) Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is on the ballot on the day of the 2024 US election.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Donald Trump lead in national polls against potential Democratic candidates in 2024?
P_or_Q.body:
(a) Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Will Donald Trump lead in national polls against potential Democratic candidates in 2024? This question will resolve as Yes if, at any point during the calendar year 2024, Donald Trump is leading in national polling averages against any potential Democratic candidate for the 2024 presidential election. The polling data must be sourced from at least three reputable polling organizations (such as Gallup, Quinnipiac, Ipsos, or FiveThirtyEight) and must be publicly available. The average must show Trump with a higher percentage of support than the Democratic candidate in question, based on a minimum of three polls conducted during the year. The question resolves as No if Trump does not lead in any national poll against any Democratic candidate at any point in 2024.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A major scandal affects Tucker Carlson's chances of being the Republican nominee before 2024 (b) Tucker Carlson is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
Q_and_not_P.body:
(a) A major scandal involving Tucker Carlson must be reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) before January 1, 2024. This scandal must significantly impact his public image and political viability as a candidate for the Republican nomination, leading to widespread media coverage, public backlash, or significant political consequences, such as loss of endorsements or support from key Republican figures. It must be of such magnitude that it is likely to affect his chances of being nominated, as assessed by political analysts or major media outlets.

(b) Tucker Carlson must not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution of this part is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or (b) a major scandal affect Tucker Carlson's chances of being the Republican nominee before 2024?
P_or_Q.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2024, a major scandal involving Tucker Carlson is reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) that significantly impacts his public image and political viability as a candidate for the Republican nomination. A 'major scandal' is defined as any incident that leads to widespread media coverage, public backlash, or significant political consequences, such as loss of endorsements or support from key Republican figures. The scandal must be of such magnitude that it is likely to affect his chances of being nominated, as assessed by political analysts or major media outlets.

metadata.source_question: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Voter turnout among Republican voters will increase significantly in the 2024 election compared to 2020; (2) Donald Trump will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
Q_and_not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By December 31, 2024, voter turnout among Republican voters in the 2024 United States presidential election is reported to be significantly higher than in the 2020 election. 'Significantly higher' is defined as an increase of at least 5 percentage points in the voter turnout rate among registered Republican voters, as reported by reputable sources such as the U.S. Census Bureau or major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The turnout rates must be based on official certified election results and may be verified through exit polls or voter surveys conducted by recognized research organizations. If the increase is less than 5 percentage points or if turnout data is inconclusive, this part will resolve as No. (2) Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this part will resolve as Yes. This part may consider new candidates added in the future. For this part, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. If both conditions are satisfied, the combined question will resolve as Yes; otherwise, it will resolve as No.

P_or_Q.title: Will either Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will voter turnout among Republican voters increase significantly in the 2024 election compared to 2020?
P_or_Q.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Voter turnout among Republican voters in the 2024 United States presidential election is reported to be significantly higher than in the 2020 election, defined as an increase of at least 5 percentage points in the voter turnout rate among registered Republican voters, as reported by reputable sources such as the U.S. Census Bureau or major news organizations. The turnout rates must be based on official certified election results and may be verified through exit polls or voter surveys conducted by recognized research organizations. If either (a) or (b) occurs, the question will resolve as **Yes**.

Q.title: Will voter turnout among Republican voters increase significantly in the 2024 election compared to 2020?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, voter turnout among Republican voters in the 2024 United States presidential election is reported to be significantly higher than in the 2020 election. 'Significantly higher' is defined as an increase of at least 5 percentage points in the voter turnout rate among registered Republican voters, as reported by reputable sources such as the U.S. Census Bureau or major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The turnout rates must be based on official certified election results and may be verified through exit polls or voter surveys conducted by recognized research organizations. If the increase is less than 5 percentage points or if turnout data is inconclusive, the question will resolve as No.

P.title: Will the Republican Party change its nomination process before the 2024 election?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2024, the Republican Party officially alters its nomination process for the 2024 presidential election in a way that is publicly documented and confirmed by the Republican National Committee (RNC). This includes any changes to the rules regarding delegate allocation, primary scheduling, or the overall structure of the nomination process. Any proposed changes must be finalized and publicly announced by the RNC, and credible reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) must corroborate the changes. Temporary or minor adjustments that do not significantly affect the nomination process will not count towards this resolution.

metadata.source_question: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Q_and_not_P.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election AND will the Republican Party not change its nomination process before the 2024 election?
Q_and_not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means the delegates of the Republican National Convention must choose him as the nominee, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) The Republican Party does not officially alter its nomination process for the 2024 presidential election before January 1, 2024, in a way that is publicly documented and confirmed by the Republican National Committee (RNC). This includes no changes to the rules regarding delegate allocation, primary scheduling, or the overall structure of the nomination process that are finalized and publicly announced by the RNC. There must also be no credible reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) corroborating any such changes. Temporary or minor adjustments that do not significantly affect the nomination process will not count towards this resolution.

P_or_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) Before January 1, 2024, the Republican Party officially alters its nomination process for the 2024 presidential election in a way that is publicly documented and confirmed by the Republican National Committee (RNC). This includes any changes to the rules regarding delegate allocation, primary scheduling, or the overall structure of the nomination process. Any proposed changes must be finalized and publicly announced by the RNC, and credible reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) must corroborate the changes. Temporary or minor adjustments that do not significantly affect the nomination process will not count towards this resolution. (b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. All other candidates will resolve as No, and the question may consider new candidates added in the future.
